channel.title: Posts on Ryan Estrellado
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Ryan Estrellado

item.title: California School Dashboards Part 2: Visualizing the Data
item.description: Three largest school districts in California # A list of urls for each dataset urls <- as.list(c( "https://query.data.world/s/RBwim7uqVwPq73bkHsYKVHbshZst0M", "https://query.data.world/s/LSizff8-rMxKNcvkhaGkHqaPhRnt-N", "https://query.data.world/s/CekXKAmUmvwDMqbWS4RDu6texq6rNn" )) all_files <- urls %>% map(~read_tsv(., col_types = cols(cds = col_character()))) # Create list names list_names <- all_files %>% map(~unique(.

item.title: How I Learned Data Science While Being A School Psychologist
California School Dashboards Part 1: Cleaning and Transforming
item.description: Introduction: It’s Ok to Skip Around I’m writing this series for data scientists, public school educators, and data scientists who are also public school educators. Turns out, this is pretty hard to do.

item.title: What It’s Like to Practice Data Scientist When You’re Not Employed As a Data Scientist
item.description: It’s great. It forces you to talk about data science without using data science vocabulary. It’s a great reminder that the statistics, programming, and code need to answer a question that means something to someone.

item.title: Public School Data is Great, But You Have to Clean It First
item.description: Using public school data can help school districts see the bigger picture of what is going on. So why don’t we see more districts taking advantage of this information gold mine?

item.title: Explaining Risk Ratios
item.description: Begin developing a practical understanding of what risk ratio means Imagine that you’re visiting three booths at the farmers market. Each booth carries some combination of apples, oranges, and pears, but you don’t know exactly what each has on the day.

item.title: Comparing Home and Away Wins of Kenny Dalglish’s Managerial Runs (Also, Did It Matter?)
item.description: After my first post, @HighlandDataSci on Twitter had a great question: Was Kenny Dalglish’s home and away win odds ratio different during his first run as manager than his second?

item.title: Liverpool FC's Managers: Home and Away Win Odds
item.description: Anfield in Liverpool is one of the legendary stadiums of English football. Fortress Anfield has been the home to many historic games, including Liverpool’s 4-3 win against Newcastle in 1996 and my personal favorite, Liverpool’s 3-1 win against Olympiacos to go through to the Champions League’s last 16.

item.title: Using Purrr to Build Custom Reports
item.description: In this post I’m going to show you how I use purrr to generate custom CSVs and plots for clients. My day job involves analyzing data for school districts and generating reports and plots for each district.
